Qualifiers.applicability: Procedure to determine if a porch is at least 50% open (evaluation method)

references.title: Roofed porches on the 1st floor
references.subheading: How to determine if a porch is at least 50% open (using Figure 5 as an example)

Qualifiers.notes: Content provides Step 1 only; subsequent steps are not present on this page.

Variables.name: porch_perimeter
Variables.description: Total perimeter length of the porch being evaluated
Variables.derivation: Sum of perimeter segments A through G

Variables.name: open_perimeter_length
Variables.description: Total length of perimeter segments that are open
Variables.ambiguity_reason: This page instructs to separate open vs closed segments but does not identify which segments are open in the example.

Variables.name: closed_perimeter_length
Variables.description: Total length of perimeter segments that are closed
Variables.ambiguity_reason: Criteria for classifying segments as closed are not provided on this page.

Variables.name: open_percentage
Variables.description: Percentage of the porch perimeter that is open
Variables.ambiguity_reason: A comparison of open vs closed segments is implied, but the formula is not explicitly stated in the provided text.

Constants.name: procedure_step_1
Constants.value: Determine the perimeter of the porch and divide it into segments that will allow a comparison of closed and open segments.

Conditions.trigger: When determining if a porch is at least 50% open
Conditions.requirement: Perform Step 1: determine the porch perimeter and divide it into segments for comparison of closed and open segments.
A porch qualifies as 'at least 50% open' if open_percentage >= 50.
Conditions.ambiguity_reason: The enforcement context and exact calculation/classification rules are not provided on this page.

Relationships.parent: Determine if a porch is at least 50% open (overall method)
Relationships.notes: This page covers only Step 1 of a likely multi-step procedure.

Relationships.relation: porch_perimeter = segment_length_A + segment_length_B + segment_length_C + segment_length_D + segment_length_E + segment_length_F + segment_length_G
Relationships.scope: Figure 5 example and general perimeter determination

Relationships.relation: open_percentage depends on open_perimeter_length and porch_perimeter
Relationships.notes: Classification of segments into 'open' vs 'closed' precedes calculation.

Relationships.relation: Sum of provided segment values vs stated total perimeter
Relationships.details: A (2) + B (8) + C (10) + D (7) + E (14) + F (24) + G (2) = 67 ft, but the perimeter note states 70 ft. This discrepancy must be resolved before validation.
